byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Jane Perlez from Beijing. Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and JANE PERLEZ

abstract: News Analysis; Obama administration seeks to play down implications of move by guided missile destroyer into Chinese territorial waters in South China Sea; action is intended to reassure allies that United States will counter moves by China to build artificial islands in Spratly Islands.
lead_paragraph: Even as it authorized the warship’s route near disputed islands, the administration played down the incident to avoid escalating conflict with China.

headline.main: White House Moves to Reassure Allies With South China Sea Patrol, but Quietly
headline.print_headline: White House Moves to Reassure Allies With South China Sea Patrol, but Quietly

snippet: Even as it authorized the warship’s route near disputed islands, the administration played down the incident to avoid escalating conflict with China.
